docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 11 (UPI) -- The Government today lifted the "state of internal war" during which security forces have severely cracked down on Tupamaro guerrillas in the last three months.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 11 (UPI) -- The Government today lifted the "state of internal war" during which security forces have severely cracked down on Tupamaro guerrillas in the last three months.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan Govt lifts state of internal war, during which security forces have severely cracked down on Tupamaros, and publishes new natl security law; law subjects accused subversives to mil cts, empowered to hand down sentences of up to 30 yrs in jail; suspension of individual rights will continue until Sept 30; in last 3 mos, over 500 Tupamaros have been jailed, 17 killed and 14 wounded

headline.main: New Antisubversive Law Takes Effect in Uruguay

docs.snippet: GENEVA, July 14 -- A band of young Swiss anarchists has established links with similar bands in West Germany and Berlin, Hans Walder, the Swiss Attorney General, said today.
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, July 14 -- A band of young Swiss anarchists has established links with similar bands in West Germany and Berlin, Hans Walder, the Swiss Attorney General, said today.
docs.abstract: Swiss Atty Gen Walder on July 14 denies rept that extremist groups including Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine have opened central office in Zurich; US intelligence officials were reptd to have said that central office was established in Zurich late in '71 and that agents and 'safe houses' were maintained by combine in Beirut and other Middle East countries

headline.main: Swiss Aide Denies Terrorist Combine Has a Zurich Office

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

headline.main: Richard Negley, Miss Thompson Marry in Texas

docs.snippet: The closest each year that the glamorous playboys of ocean powerboat racing get to the glamorous playboy city of New York is the Hennessy Grand Prix, which starts and ends off Point Pleasant, N J., about 65 miles away.
docs.lead_paragraph: The closest each year that the glamorous playboys of ocean powerboat racing get to the glamorous playboy city of New York is the Hennessy Grand Prix, which starts and ends off Point Pleasant, N J., about 65 miles away.

docs.snippet: When Fidel Castro visited Moscow in 1964, he was greeted by Premier Khrushchev with great Russian bear hugs and extolled as a revolutionary in his prime. Last weekend, Mr. Castro returned home again after a new trip to the Soviet Union -- but this...
docs.lead_paragraph: When Fidel Castro visited Moscow in 1964, he was greeted by Premier Khrushchev with great Russian bear hugs and extolled as a revolutionary in his prime. Last weekend, Mr. Castro returned home again after a new trip to the Soviet Union -- but this time his Russian notices seemed mixed.
docs.abstract: Rev of Premier Castro's trip to USSR and E Eur countries; trip considered successful in light of Soviet assurances of continued econ aid; illus of Castro and state leaders taken during trip

headline.main: For Fidel, A Medal And a Lecture; Cuba:

docs.snippet: Over the years, newcomers have been drawn to the Jackson Heights section of northern Queens because of its attractive residential homes and apartments and its proximity to Manhattan. From midtown, it is only seven miles away, a 20-minute ride on the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Over the years, newcomers have been drawn to the Jackson Heights section of northern Queens because of its attractive residential homes and apartments and its proximity to Manhattan. From midtown, it is only seven miles away, a 20-minute ride on the subway.

headline.main: Jackson Heights Shops a U.N. All Their Own

docs.snippet: Uruguayan labor unions on July 17 begin series of strikes directed against econ policies of Pres Bordaberry; workers are demanding 40% increase in salaries
docs.abstract: Uruguayan labor unions on July 17 begin series of strikes directed against econ policies of Pres Bordaberry; workers are demanding 40% increase in salaries

docs.snippet: R Wald comment advocating legalization of abortion law stresses woman's right to bear only wanted children; contends no great difference exists between numbers of abortions performed in countries in which abortion is legal and in those in which it is...
docs.abstract: R Wald comment advocating legalization of abortion law stresses woman's right to bear only wanted children; contends no great difference exists between numbers of abortions performed in countries in which abortion is legal and in those in which it is not because abortion will be performed whenever women find themselves pregnant and unwilling to have child; says legalization lowers mortality rate from abortions because, where abortion is freely available, it can be performed early in pregnancy and by qualified people; cites econ discrimination in antiabortion laws because well-to-do women can obtain abortions no matter what law says, either by paying price of illegal abortion or by traveling to places where abortion is legal

headline.main: The Right to Bear Wanted Children; "Well-to-do women can obtain abortions no matter what the law says."

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 25 (Reuters) -- The Tupamaros, Uruguay's left-wing urban guerrillas, today machine-gunned to death their highest ranking military victim. He was Artigas Alvarez, a 49-year-old colonel who was chief of civilian defense.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 25 (Reuters) -- The Tupamaros, Uruguay's left-wing urban guerrillas, today machine-gunned to death their highest ranking military victim. He was Artigas Alvarez, a 49-year-old colonel who was chief of civilian defense.
docs.abstract: Tupamaros on July 25 shoot and kill chief of civilian defense Col Alvarez in his car as he is leaving home; Alvarez is brother of Gen G Alvarez, who is in charge of Govt struggle against Tupamaros

headline.main: TUPAMAROS KILL AN ARMY OFFICER; Assassination Is First Leftist Violence in Weeks

docs.snippet: The United States Army and armies in Western Europe and Latin America are devoting more and more time and effort to the operational techniques of urban guerrilla warfare.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Army and armies in Western Europe and Latin America are devoting more and more time and effort to the operational techniques of urban guerrilla warfare.
docs.abstract: NY Times survey of attention being paid to urban guerrilla warfare by US Army and armies of W Eur and Latin Amer nations; techniques of warfare and methods of combating them discussed; US Army field manual quoted

keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSSESSIONS
